reviewText:
Product received for free

Played with the Vive:

Since I didn't have anyone to talk to these are my impressions of the application alone without the chat feature.

The environments were okay, controller support was good, movement was okay with the exception of the hover platform which was fun.

What I'd like to see:
A virtual pet to play with, The ability to listen to the music in different environments, maybe a movie theather where you can watch youtube videos with others.

For a chat application I give it a 3.5 out of 5.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This was my first time getting my hands on the Vive and I thought the game's tutorial introduced me to using this VR system nicely. SurrealVR's use of the controllers gave a good experience in being able to interact with a virtual world and others in it. I liked the set pieces and atmospheric sound design. This game offers a few different game options that help illustrate the power of the Vive (and VR in general), and gets me excited to see what new updates come out for this game.
voteText: 14 of 24 people (58%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Works great on the HTC Vive!! Yes it needs the Vive to work right now, but what they have so far is awesome! I cant wait for them to add more features; I'll definitely play around with this some more!

reviewText: This is so great I can\'t wait to see more from these guys and I know they have big plans from seeing a demo at an event.\nThe bad reviews boggle me, I have had a lot of fun in here and know it\'s the first of many great things to come from the Surreal team. awesome stuff!

reviewText: As far as SteamVR social apps go, this game is top notch. It has several well textured environments that offer a convincing atmosphere. Communicating with other avatars was automatic and easy. Moving takes a little getting used to, but I figured it out after about 10 minutes. My first hour flew past and then I ran into some interesting people where I had a good laugh with them. Well worth investigating - and hey, it's free!

reviewText: This game definitely has some potential. With the vive I was able to throw and catch objects. felt pretty cool and realistic! Looking forward to the dino level in the screenshots of this game. that looks awesome! I can see it getting more and more evolved and in depth as it grows. Feels like in VR its kind of like the start of simulated world exploration.

reviewText: I found it fun to explore the various scenes, and was even able to voice chat with someone else while on the ship. This game has real potential, especially given the developer's willingness to listen to our suggestions - speaking of which I have several to pass along, particulary on the controls. I can't wait for more people to discover this game as I can see it being a great place to hang out and meet new people.

reviewText: Social VR is here!\nReally cool idea. it's quite fun to be able to interact with othe players in VR. The idea of a cruise ship is nice. Can't wat to see all the stuff that can be explored.\nI ran into a minor installing issue and contacted the developer. They were able to help me inmediately. These guys seem to be pretty dedicated to it and are looking to add more cool features. For a free to play VR game it's got a ton of fun stuff to do. Totally recommend

reviewText: Finally on Steam!  I first had a chance to play with Surreal a few months ago, and it was quite impressive.  I was chatting and interacting in real time with people all over the world as we explored the environments the Surreal team put together.  It looks like some of their more recent features they were demoing at the time aren't in this version yet, but I can't wait!  I spent some time with their team and they are avid gamers who are really excited about their plans for Surreal.  I'm counting on regular updates and patches, please take a look at locomotion.  There might be a reason for it being somewhat slow but those of us used to running around in FPS find it frustrating.  Thanks!
voteText: 5 of 12 people (42%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
1. The teleport function has no clear indicator to where you will land
2. Physics and collision are not functioning
3. Dinosaurs and other animals have no impact i.e. no splash effect
4. the avatars are rigid and can not interact with the environment i.e. pick up someone else's maraca in the club
5. Falsly advertising the fact you can use Google Cardboard or another headset WITHOUT hand controllers
6. Menu doesn't come up when you press the grip button - sometimes I have to press it 16 times for it to appear
7. Falsly advertises leg, face and mouth tracking in it's advert as well as customising avatars facial features

It needs a whole lot of work (maybe a couple of years and a couple of decent designers) for it to actually feature the lists of expectations described in it's trailer.
